intro: Lloydia alpina, commonly known as the alpine lloydia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Liliaceae, which includes many familiar garden plants such as tulips and lilies. This perennial herb is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Lloydia alpina typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. It is often found at elevations above 6,000 feet and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
